column1: Revocation / indy-sdk proof verification fails after issuing a second or more credentials
column24:
We are facing some issues with proofing credentials issued on cred defs with revocation support.
When there's only one credential issued for the corresponding revoc reg everything is fine.
But if we issue another credential, every following proof is verified as false.
Attached you can find some code, using mainly the indy sdk and also some functions from the Aries Framework for .NET.

This has already been discussed in the aries and ursa chatrooms and was beeing considered to be related to ursa.
column25: The Agent is running inside a docker container based on ubuntu 18.04 as libindy 1.11.1 from [https://repo.sovrin.org/sdk/deb] xenial stable is used.

column24:
The easiest way for us to support the Chinese SM and Russian GOST crypto is to support OpenSSL as a provider for basic crypto primitives in Ursa. The RFC is being collaboratively edited on the wiki.

[https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/ursa/0000-OpenSSL-Interface|https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/ursa/0000-OpenSSL-Interface]

column24: Right now, CL signatures are implemented in libursa. CL Signatures are largely used for ZKPs. The signature is more advanced and should be moved to zmix for use with signature proofs of  knowledge.
column43: (Please add high level design or a link to the design)

column24:
Ursa needs an API for generalizing cryptographic hashes.

This should include two layers: a low-level layer for advanced crypto users, and a dev layer that is misuse resistant and straightforward.
